stimulusHtml: Which of the following best describes how an increase in the concentration of substrate in the reaction mixture affected the frequency of enzyme‑substrate interactions?

features.html:
Figure 1. Rate of an enzyme-catalyzed reaction

Researchers investigated the dynamics of a reaction catalyzed by an enzyme. The researchers prepared a series of reactions, each with the same concentration of enzyme but with different concentrations of substrate. The researchers measured the amount of product in each reaction mixture after 5 minutes. The results are shown in Figure 1.

choicesHtml: The frequency of enzyme-substrate interactions decreased over all substrate concentrations.
The frequency of enzyme-substrate interactions increased exponentially over all substrate concentrations.
The frequency of enzyme-substrate interactions increased until all of the active sites were interacting with substrate.
The frequency of enzyme-substrate interactions increased until all of the enzyme was depleted.
